clinical_study.brief_title: Sequential Application of Yisaipu® and DMARDs in Treating Mild-to-Moderate AS
clinical_study.official_title: Sequential Application of Yisaipu® and Disease Modifying Anti-Rheumatic Drugs (DMARDs) in Treating Mild-to-Moderate Ankylosing Spondylitis: the Mid-term Follow-up Result

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The drug regimes in treating ankylosing spondylitis(AS) have limitations. The tumor necrosis factor inhibitors(TNFi) was effective but expensive. Disease modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (DMARDs) were cheap but insufficient. This study proposed a sequential usage of TNFi, the Yisaipu®, and DMARDs, and aims to evaluate the mid-term therapeutic effect of this new scheme in treating the mild-to-moderate AS.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Yisaipu® was introduced only during the active state and was switched to DMARDs, methotrexate(MTX), sulfasalazine(SSZ) and hydroxychloroquine(HCQ), after disease remission (ESR & CRP reduce to normal and BASDAI＜4) maintenance.

secondary_outcome.description: SQOL-AS(The Scale of Quality of Life for Ankylosing Spondylitis) questionnaire consists of physiological function, psychological state, social adaptation and self-awareness 4 dimensions. There are 5 to 8 questions in every dimension. The score ranges are 8 to 40 for physiological function, 6 to 30 for psychological state, 5 to 25 for social adaptation and 6 to 30 for self-awareness. The more score that patients got means the better state they were in that dimension, namely, the batter quality of life.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1.Clinical diagnosis of Ankylosing Spondylitis(AS) based on modified New York diagnostic criteria for AS (1984) 2.At the mild-to-moderate stage of AS disease 3.At the active phase of AS disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1.Active tuberculosis, hepatitis, tumors, infection diseases or combine with other rheumaimmune systemic diseases or osteoarthritis diseases 2.Pregnant or breastfeeding women
